article_title: Indiana police charge teen over stolen gun
article_text:
The other two males are being sought, police said.

The teen, who was not identified, was taken to a juvenile detention center pending a hearing. He was charged with receiving stolen property, possession of a firearm without a license, possession of a firearm by a minor, disorderly conduct, underage drinking and loitering.

As officers tackled him, the teen discarded a loaded handgun, according to the police report.

The officer was able to catch one 17-year-old, who had run back to the original location.

Borough police responded to a call about a group of young people prowling in some bushes on North 15th Street about 1:17 a.m. When an officer arrived, three males ran away along Philadelphia Street, according to a report from the police department.
